intro: Casearia turbinata, commonly known as the Turbinated Casearia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Salicaceae family, which includes willows and poplars, and is characterized by its opposite, simple leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in catkins, typical of the family. Its fruits are capsules that release small, winged seeds, aiding in wind dispersal. Casearia turbinata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
